DepthSense::Utils::SharedMemory Class Reference

This class is a utility class to allocate and deallocate some shared memory chunks. More...

Detailed Description

A shared memory area is designed by a name and an instance index.

Member Function Documentation

std::string& DepthSense::Utils::SharedMemory::getBaseName ( )

the base name.
bool DepthSense::Utils::SharedMemory::getIsStandalone ( ) const

Returns
true if the user application is running in standalone mode, false otherwise.
void* DepthSense::Utils::SharedMemory::getPtr ( std::string  name,
unsigned int  index,
unsigned int  size,
bool  isServer 
)

Each named area can have multiple instance designated by an index. The shared memory is allocated automatically if needed.

Parameters
[in]nameshared memory area name.
[in]indexinstance index of the shared memory area.
[in]sizesize in bytes of the shared memory area.
[in]isServertrue if the calling process is the server, false if it is client.
Returns
a pointer to the desired shared memory area.
Exceptions
std::bad_allocif index is greater than the maximum number of buffers allowed or the memory could not be allocated.
